hypothesis_content.title: News-Driven Spike Fade with Volume Profile Analysis
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC spikes >4% in 1 hour coinciding with major news headlines (detected via news sentiment API), and the spike occurs into a high-volume node from previous day's Volume Profile, price will retrace to the Point of Control (POC) within 6-12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes into high-volume nodes often represent liquidity events where informed sellers provide liquidity to emotional buyers. Weak closes after high volume suggest lack of follow-through.
entry_conditions: News sentiment score > 0.7 (positive) from major outlets
Spike price level intersects with previous day's Volume Profile high-volume node (top 30% of volume)
Spike volume > 150% of 20-period average but closes in bottom 50% of candle range (weak close)
Regime: Any except STRESS (which may have sustained news-driven moves)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to previous day's Volume Profile POC
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks above spike high by >1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >60% of such news spikes continue trending in same direction for >8 hours without retracing to POC.
